title: Why would you never buy a PC? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not sure why I was A2A’d about never buying a PC. Sure for gaming etc. I’d be very unlikely to buy a “Pre-Assembled” I tend to customize and build computers to my liking. I’ll laugh if someone says they’ll never buy a “PC” since that shows a lack of understanding the actual definition of PC = Personal Computer A smartphone = a PC, a Tablet = PC, a Netbook/Laptop/Tower/ etc. are all PC’s Sure Microsoft’s been trying to “Market PC as Windows Computer” but does everyone fall for “Marketing?” are people that easily manipulated? I’ve got several PC’s a Smartphone, a Gaming PC, a NAS, and commercial grade layer 3 networking equipment. I honestly can hardly imagine a future where I didn’t own a PC…perhaps if we were to move to something like a Star Trek future. Some sort of paradise where the people share in their wealth.

I will always buy a PC, for me its more like I will never buy a console or Apple device. Like it or hate it, I have a lot of usage for which I need a PC. I know Win10 isn’t good, mainly because of their forced updates & recent problems with those updates. But still it works for me & is good for most people. You can use Linux based OS as well, if you are fine with its limitations like some apps not supported & rarely any good games.
